bibl.title: A Roman Station at Abu Rawash.
bibl.note: Archaeological reconnaissance 1991 and 1992 on the summit of the Gebel Abu Rawash (on the west of Babylon), the highest point in the local topography, at 160 m above sea level. The outpost commands an immense panorama in almost every direction.
bibl.seg: JONES Michael, A Roman Station at Abu Rawash.

Archaeological reconnaissance 1991 and 1992 on the summit of the Gebel Abu Rawash (on the west of Babylon), the highest point in the local topography, at 160 m above sea level. The outpost commands an immense panorama in almost every direction.
